context: Developed a multi-turn therapy assistant by combining Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) with Cache-Augmented Generation (CAG) to improve emotional intelligence, safety, and memory retention in chatbot responses.
objectives: Fine-tuned GPT‑4o‑mini and configured LLaMA 3.2–1B Instruct for hybrid RAG+CAG pipelines.
Used RAG to retrieve prior session summaries via ChromaDB embeddings, enabling personalized recall.
Leveraged CAG to preload therapeutic knowledge, ensuring grounded and empathetic responses.
Created a chatbot capable of emotionally-aware, context-rich mental health conversations.
Achieved strong performance through semantic and human evaluation by a licensed clinical psychologist.
features: Hybrid pipeline combining ChromaDB (RAG) and static knowledge base (CAG).
Earned average human rating of 4.5/5 on empathy, clarity, and supportiveness.
Maintained low-latency inference despite multi-turn context expansion.
Deployed multi-model evaluation framework with structured memory recall.
